meanings.sent1: The children were engrossed in their favorite storybook.
meanings.sent2: She was so engrossed in her painting that she didn't notice the time passing.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was engrossed in chasing its tail, providing entertainment for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The audience was engrossed in the magician's performance, amazed by every trick.
meanings.sent5: The detective was engrossed in solving the mystery, determined to find the culprit.

meanings.definition: To write or print in a large, clear script
meanings.sent1: The teacher engrossed the instructions on the whiteboard for all the students to see.
meanings.sent2: She engrossed the title of the book in beautiful calligraphy on the cover.
meanings.sent3: The artist engrossed the lyrics of the song in elegant cursive on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The scribe engrossed the royal decree in bold letters for everyone to read.
meanings.sent5: The calligrapher engrossed the wedding invitation in a stunning font, impressing the guests.

meanings.definition: To acquire or take possession of (a right, title, etc.) by written agreement
meanings.sent1: The company engrossed the property deed after the successful negotiation.
meanings.sent2: He engrossed the copyright of his novel to protect his work.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer engrossed the contract, ensuring all terms were clearly stated.
meanings.sent4: The government engrossed the land rights through a legal document.
meanings.sent5: The artist engrossed the licensing agreement to showcase his artwork in galleries.
